intro: Espeletia hartwegiana subsp. hartwegiana, commonly known as the Hartweg's espeletia, is a perennial plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its rosette formation of thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions and well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and is of interest to horticulturists and botanists.
